Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk system-config-printer
exit 0

exit 0

function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: system-config-printer bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated system-config-printer packages that fix several bugs are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The system-config-printer packages contain a print queue configuration tool with a graphical user interface.
This update fixes the following bugs:
* Previously, the system-config-printer packages were not built with security hardening features. The part with privileges was run by the udev device manager, and this executable file was not built as position-independent code (PIE), or built with a read-only relocation section (RELRO). With this update, the security hardening features have been enabled, and the udev component now has both PIE and RELRO protections. (BZ#1092554)
* Prior to this update, a printer reported a supply level but did not specify a color for it. Consequently, the system-config-printer application would stop with a traceback. A patch has been applied to address this bug, and system-config-printer now handles missing color specification correctly. (BZ#1112334)
* The CUPS IPP attribute "document-count" was renamed to "number-of-documents" but the system-config-printer application previously incorrectly used the old name. As a consequence, attempting to retrieve a printing job had no effect. With this update, system-config-printer now looks for the correct "number-of-documents" attribute. (BZ#1119227)
All users of system-config-printer are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
